body_html: IMO resize_ should not be exposed at all; if it needs to be used internally it should be used as a private method _resize. Are there any user-side uses for it that aren't mistakes? (It's useful in framework code when you know a resize is safe and want the equivalent of an in-place view)
body_text: IMO resize_ should not be exposed at all; if it needs to be used internally it should be used as a private method _resize. Are there any user-side uses for it that aren't mistakes? (It's useful in framework code when you know a resize is safe and want the equivalent of an in-place view)
body: IMO `resize_` should not be exposed at all; if it needs to be used internally it should be used as a private method `_resize`. Are there any user-side uses for it that aren't mistakes? (It's useful in framework code when you know a resize is safe and want the equivalent of an in-place view)
